intro: Corispermum hyssopifolium var. rubricaule, commonly known as the red-stemmed bladderwrath, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems that are typically reddish in color, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or purple in color, which bloom in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This species is often found in sandy or gravelly soils in dry, open habitats.
